intro: Paronychia erythraea, commonly known as the red sandalwood, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody stems. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are often borne in dense clusters. Its leaves are typically opposite and have a slightly hairy texture. Paronychia erythraea is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
